requiredMaterials.title: Putting Essential Understanding Into Practice: Statistics 9-12
requiredMaterials.author: NCTM

courseGoals: Develop your own understanding of statistics
Learn to teach statistics/probability to middle and high school students
coursePhilosophy: Very practical class focused on developing understanding and pedagogical skills for teaching statistics and probability

aiPolicy.note: These tools can be helpful if used well; students expected to understand material and construct conceptual explanations on own

guidelines.guideline: Reading/watching explanations from others or AI is easier than constructing it yourself
AI-generated explanations cannot be included in anything submitted for class
guidelines.applies: Including all tools and people-generated content

inClassParticipation.description: Colleagues working together toward becoming great teachers
requirements: Attend all class sessions, arriving on time and staying until end
Participate in group work and discussions
Make regular contributions (beyond personal comfort zone recommended)

weeklyScoring.3Points: Contributions to discussion in both small groups and whole class
weeklyScoring.2Points: Contributions to small groups, but only little to whole class
weeklyScoring.1Point: Only minor contributions to small groups, or no contribution to whole class
weeklyScoring.minus1: Arrive late or leave early (each time)

inClassParticipation.drops: One free dropped weekly participation score for illness, emergency, or other issues
inClassParticipation.comportment: Everyone should be absolutely respectful; disagreements fine if respectful and professional

homework.dueTime: 10 minutes before start of next class
homework.submission: Electronic through Learning Suite (typed or handwritten scans)
homework.focus: Developing you as teacher and conceptual understanding, not just getting answers
homework.timeExpectation: Expect 2-3 hours per assignment depending on assignment
homework.warning: Don't plan on rushing right before due date - won't have time

unitCheckInTests.testing: Check-in test at end of each unit in testing center
unitCheckInTests.preparation: See unit schedules in Learning Suite for exact dates and prep details

comprehensiveProject.purpose: Carry out and report on statistical studies of your own
comprehensiveProject.timing: Good time to start is about halfway through semester
comprehensiveProject.details: Detailed instructions posted in Learning Suite

meaActivities.gradePenalty: For each uncompleted activity, grade lowered by one step (A to A-, etc.); no activities = two step drop

lateAndMakeup.makeupWork: No make-up work if not turned in
lateAndMakeup.emergency: Contact instructor BEFORE emergency occurs if possible to arrange alternative

drops.homework: Lowest single homework assignment score dropped
drops.purpose: Already meant to account for illness and emergencies
drops.flexibility: Long-term emergencies can be worked out with instructor

honorCode.standard: Students expected to be honest in all academic work
honorCode.definition: Work presented as your own must in fact be your own work, not another's
honorCode.violation: May result in failing grade and additional university disciplinary action
honorCode.dressAndGrooming: Expected to adhere to BYU Honor Code standards

sexualDiscrimination.prohibition: Title IX prohibits sex discrimination in education programs or activities
sexualDiscrimination.scope: Covers discrimination, admissions, activities, student-to-student sexual harassment
sexualDiscrimination.reporting: Talk to professor, contact Equal Employment Office (422-5895 or 367-5689, 24 hours), or Honor Code Office (422-2847)

disability.office: Services for Students with Disabilities Office
disability.process: Contact for evaluation if disability impairs ability to complete course
disability.accommodations: Reasonable academic accommodations reviewed for qualified students with documented disabilities
